intro: Carum pityophilum, commonly known as the California mountain parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies. Carum pityophilum is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
